jobs_results.title: Project Manager
jobs_results.via: via MNC Jobs Singapore | MNC Jobs In Singapore
jobs_results.description:
Roles & Responsibilities
• Participate in RFI/RFP
• Work on the project scoping during presales to size up the project management effort, and the write-out on project management section for proposal
• Manage multiple projects ensuring Project Scopes, Schedules, Resources and Outcomes are within project milestone timeline and budget
• Manage project resources, vendors, contractors and deliver according to scope and schedule
• Manage procurement and delivery
• Ensure project signoff timely
• Manage project financial with prudence
• Prepare Project Management Life Cycle documentation
• Conduct Project meetings (project Kick-off, PWC, PSC, etc.) and ensure project minutes timely
• Good communication and interpersonal skills to engage the different levels of stakeholders and can perform under pressure
• Conduct Project completion debrief to identify lessons learn to contribute to knowledge base
• Update Project Repository folders regularly
• Closely monitor, anticipate and escalate project... issue early to address situation
• Complying to PMO Governance Guidelines

Requirements:
• Degree in Information Technology
• PMP certified
• Agile Scrum Methodology - advantage
• ITIL Foundation V3/V4
• Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) - advantage
• Preferably with CCNA/CCNP
• MCSE/VCP certification – optional

jobs_results.title: #EDMS2020 - Technical Operations Manager (Core Network/ 1yr Direct Contract)
jobs_results.description:
Responsibilities

• Conducts project management activities using preferred organizational practices & established processes contained in PM Methodology (PMM)

• Holds accountability for project schedule, scope and resources utilization performance and the achievement of project objectives

• Map out overall project execution plan

• Track actual cost & schedule against baselined budget and plan

• Manage customer’s requirements and project scope

• Deliver timely and quality outputs based on defined processes

• Provide regular and accurate updates to Customer

• Maintain effective communication channels with stakeholders

• Manage issues & risks and ensure timely escalation

• Ability to manage concurrent tasks

Ideal candidate should possess

• At least 4yrs of experience in Operations/ Project Management, specifically in Network Projects.

• Strong technical background in Core Network

• ITIL Foundation and PMP certification or equivalent

jobs_results.title: IT Project Manager
jobs_results.description:
Position: Project Manager

The Project Manager plans and oversees one or more interdependent projects that impact one or more business units. The successful candidate oversees all aspects of the assigned project throughout project lifecycles to ensure completion within the defined scope, quality, and time and cost constraints. You will develop the project plan and execute the project. You will ensure accurate allocations of resources throughout the project. You will lead multi-disciplinary teams, composed of various levels of personnel, vendors, and clients to create and deploy successful projects.

You have a successful track record in project management, user and vendor management, excellent communication skills, capable of effectively influencing various internal and external stakeholders.

Minimum Qualification:

· Diploma / Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent

· Working experience in developing, implementing and maintaining IT systems.

· Strong... analytical skills and ability to work independently

Added Advantage:

· CITPM / PMP certification

· Experience in healthcare IT industry

· Experience SAP FI/CO, SD/MM, HRIS, ISH, S4HANA

· Experience in managing projects in ONE OR MORE areas of knowledge: Healthcare IT domain knowledge, Enterprise Resource Planning systems (SAP, Oracle), HRIS, CRM, FI/CO, SD/MM, S4HANA, Sunrise Clinical Manager (Allscript), OpenText (OScript), database technology (SQL/NoSQL), Microsoft .NET, Full Stack Web Development, RTLS or RFID or BLE technology, CISCO technology, Healthcare IT standards (HL7, DICOM), Medical Diagnostic Imaging technology, OnBase, LifeRay/PEGA or RPA.

Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted.

Rob Warner

Morgan McKinley Pte Ltd EA Licence No: 11C5502 | EAP Registration No: R2090074

jobs_results.title: Project Manager - Artificial Intelligence (AI)
IT Project Manager coordinator - Contract
jobs_results.description:
Requirements:
• At least a Diploma/Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or equivalent with at least 4-5 years of hands-on experience in IT project management specialize in IT operations, stakeholder, and vendor management.
• Strong analytical, conceptualization and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to present ideas and influence stakeholders.
• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
• PMP / PRINCE II certification is a plus.

Responsibilities:
• Work with IT leader and various user’s project leader to define business needs and objectives of new IT initiatives.
• Assist IT leader in developing IT business plan and budget in align with other business units and company goals.
• Prepare RFPs, assess proposals from vendors and recommend the solution best meeting business needs and objectives.
• Manage the outsource delivery teams for service quality and excellence.
• Oversight SLA management, vendor management... and contract management; Drive service agility, quality, and security controls for the company.
• Manage and consolidate reports from vendors for operations and report regularly in Project Management Meetings
• Perform risk management to minimize project risks.
• Manage and monitor the product implementation and progress to ensure completion on agreed schedules.
• Manage and monitor the transition of customer care outsourcing initiative.
• Manage and co-ordinate the activities of a team of system development, maintenance, and support staff.
• Provide timely report on project status and activities for upper management

jobs_results.title: Project Manager-Java & Data
jobs_results.description:
About Our Client

Our client is a leading technology solutions provider with strong presence within the region. They are looking to hire a Project Manager- Java & Data.

Job Description

As a Project Manager- Java & Data, you will be responsible for the following:
• Identifying, planning, organising, and defining time-line for the projects and providing support post implementation.
• Working with the developers to deliver solutions on time and working with clients on project feasibility and budgets.
• Gathering requirements from the clients and translating them into solutions as per the needs.
• Tracking and reporting project performance from time to time.
• Sharing reviews and feedback with the clients on the projects and mentoring the team internally.
• Managing the project budget, delivery and making sure timelines are being followed.

The Successful Applicant

As a successful consultant you should have a bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent with at least 8 years of... experience in IT project management within the application space along with data. You will have experience in doing java projects within the financial service industry. You will also have experience in working on data related projects as well. PMP or CITPM certification will be an added advantage.

What's on Offer
• Newly Created Role
• Great Working Environment

jobs_results.title: IT Project Manager
jobs_results.description:
Job Description

The successful candidate will join a project management team to support project director to manage multiple project implementation tracks that cover from requirement gathering to post implementation support
The role is expected to support the Project Director in:
• Developing the project plan including detailed activities, resources and timeline, and maintaining project documentation
• Working with stakeholders to establish consensus on work stream objectives and deliverables
• Leading the project team members including business users to deliver the project output including functional requirement, business process maps, testing strategy, test plan, implementation plan and post-implementation support
• Monitoring progress of the activities and conduct regular reviews to recommend schedule changes or resource adjustments
• Coordinating project delivery and work with internal Business/IT stakeholders and external vendor to establish the desired and stipulated project... priority and timeline to meet the business operations
• Supporting change management through facilitating user training and coaching
• Managing business relationships and monitor vendor performance against SLAs
• Managing the change request process internally and externally to ensure timely escalation of any issues

Requirement
• Minimum Bachelor's degree from a recognised University, preferably in Information Management/ Computer Science/Information Technology/Business Management.
• At least 10 years' of project or IT management experience, with experience in support and implementation of student management system in the tertiary education sector preferred.
• Strong technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies.
• Experience on implementation of COTS (commercial off-the-shelf) solution at enterprise level is an added advantage.
• Preferably with PMP / PRINCE II /Agile certification.
• Excellent communication skills to influence all levels of internal stakeholders and external parties
• Strong project and people management skills to drive results
• Organised, analytical and detailed-oriented
• Ability to work under pressure on multiple projects within a set timeframe
• A passion for creating solutions with a positive attitude to change
Hiring Institution: NTU

jobs_results.title: Senior/it Project Manager   It & System Operations
jobs_results.via: via MNC Jobs Singapore | MNC Jobs In Singapore
jobs_results.description:
Manage program or project development and implementation relating to IT applications/systems, both new application/system development and enhancement of existing applications/systems. This involves managing the progress of the projects to ensure completion to schedule; management of resources across projects.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Coordinate and manage program/project activities for adherence to program/project plan & goals; monitor results against established timelines, deliverables, tasks, dependencies & associated technical specifications
• Develop and manage the detailed program/project plans, work breakdown structures, program/project checklists & budgets to meet established time frames, funding limitations, & staffing availability
• Prepare and manage the comprehensive supporting plans in the areas of quality control, risk management, change management, testing & other associated program/project management areas
• Manage program/project development process to include monitoring... program/project scope & change control processes
• Develop or contribute to business case preparation and analysis
• Manage the tender, evaluation and related procurement processes for assigned projects
• Interact, lead or coordinate program/project activities at all levels and across the organization

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Academic Education & Experience
• Degree in Information Systems or equivalent.
• At least 8-12 years of working experience with 8 years in IT program/project management
• Experience in vendor, service, stakeholders and people management.
• Experience in agile project management and in managing mid to large scale IT projects.

Professional Education/License (if any)
• Have PMP, Agile PM, Prince2 or equivalent certification.
• Have SCRUM Master certification is advantageous

Skills and knowledge
• Proven experience in program management.
• Proven stakeholder management skills.
• Proven experience managing a team.
• Excellent interpersonal, strong people management and communication skills both written and oral with proven ability to communicate at all levels.
• Ability to influence and negotiate.
• Have broad exposure and understanding of technology (both hardware and software).
• Have a good problem-solving skill that is able to analyze issues from multiple perspectives and derive pragmatic and comprehensive solutions to problems in sometimes an ambiguous environment

jobs_results.title: Technical Delivery Manager
jobs_results.description:
Project execution, including planning and directing internal and external project resources to ensure delivery of project outputs within agreed parameters such as time, cost, scope and quality

• Co-ordinate the pre-project planning, including scoping, project plan, effort and cost estimates.
• Project execution, including planning and directing internal and external project resources to ensure delivery of project outputs within agreed parameters such as time, cost, scope and quality
• Manage and coordinate the overall end-to-end project activities across various technology teams
• Facilitate and drive data mappings and functional specification design and solution discussions across various technology teams and user groups.
• Drive the testing strategy discussions and provide oversight on the testing activities.
• Coordinate and develop the overall end-to-end deployment migration plan and activities.
• Identify risks and issues, and take appropriate measures to ensure delivery remains... on track, within approved budget and schedule
• Timely review and update of project plans, resources, budgets and time-frames, and assign tasks
• Organise and chair governance meetings, including preparation of meeting materials and minutes
• Stakeholders engagement throughout the project delivery phase
• Ensure work deliverables are in compliance with bank policies and regulatory requirements.

Key Requirements

Domain Knowledge
• Knowledge in Finance & Risk (eg. Basel IV, Expense / Cost Allocation, IFRS 9, Finance / MAS reporting)
• Understanding of technical aspects of system integration in a mix technology environment.

Qualifications & Skills:
• Minimum 15 years in project management in IT in delivering complex projects, preferably in the area of finance systems
• Certification or formal training in project management is an advantage
• Self-starter with excellent leadership and team building skills
• Ability to resolve complex problems creatively
• Detailed oriented and hands-on
